alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Local snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
This evening through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Lake effect flurries will develop this evening. Strong northwest winds gusting to 70 km/h combined with the falling snow will reduce visibility in local blowing snow. Flurries will weaken Tuesday morning.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Local snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Lake effect flurries have developed off Lake Huron. Northwesterly winds gusting to 70 km/h combined with the falling snow will result in local blowing snow further reducing visibility. Flurries will weaken Tuesday morning.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Additional local snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Heavy flurries will continue as a cold front passes through the area and lake effect snow develops in behind. Strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h will also develop late this afternoon, further reducing visibility in local blowing snow. Flurries will weaken Tuesday morning.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Additional local snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm. The higher snowfall amounts are expected south of Georgian Bay for locations east of Owen Sound to Stayner.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday afternoon.

Additional information:
Lake effect flurries have developed off Georgian Bay. Northwesterly winds gusting to 70 km/h combined with the falling snow will result in local blowing snow further reducing visibility. Flurries will weaken Tuesday afternoon.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Strong winds tonight into Tuesday.

What:
Northwesterly winds gusting up to 80 km/h.

When:
Continuing into early Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Strong winds have developed in the wake of a cold front. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. For areas recovering from the recent ice storm, high winds may slow restoration efforts and result in new outages.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes
Peterborough City - Lakefield - Southern Peterborough County

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow tonight into Tuesday.

What:
Heavy snow with total accumulations near 15 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 5 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday afternoon.

Additional information:
The heaviest snow is expected to fall overnight into Tuesday morning. Northwesterly winds gusting to 60 km/h will also develop Tuesday morning. Strong wind gusts combined with the falling snow will result in local blowing snow further reducing visibility. The snow will end and the wind will ease Tuesday afternoon.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow tonight into Tuesday.

What:
Heavy snow with total accumulations of 15 to 25 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 3 to 5 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday afternoon.

Additional information:
The heaviest snow is expected to fall overnight into early Tuesday morning. Northwesterly winds gusting to 60 km/h will also develop overnight. Strong wind gusts combined with the falling snow will result in local blowing snow further reducing visibility. The morning commute will be impacted. The snow will end and the wind will ease Tuesday afternoon.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Local snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Lake effect snow has developed off Lake Huron. Northwesterly winds gusting to 70 km/h combined with the falling snow will result in local blowing snow further reducing visibility. The morning commute may be impacted. Lake effect snow will weaken Tuesday morning.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow and local blowing snow continues.

What:
Heavy snow with total accumulations of 15 to 25 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 3 to 5 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Ending early Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Northerly winds gusting up to 60 km/h will further reduce visibility in local blowing snow. Snow will taper to flurries early Tuesday morning.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.
